[/INST]Key risks of borrowing to invest include: 1) Increased returns and losses - Borrowing can lead to higher returns in a rising market but larger losses if the market declines. 2) Capital risk - If the value of your investment decreases, you may owe more than the investment is worth. 3) Income risk - The investment might not generate the expected income, affecting your ability to cover loan repayments. 4) Interest rate risk - An increase in interest rates can raise borrowing costs, impacting the profitability of your investment.</s>

The strategy relies on the investment's value increasing over time to offset these losses.</s>
